answers.answer: That is an easy way to psyche yourself out! HahaWhile i am overweight myself, i  had complications in the beginning of my pregnancy. Nothing horrible just a SCH (subchorionic hematoma) which is where there was a clot that got forced out and i blef a lot. Scary! As i was told again and again that i had nothing to worry about, preterm delivery had been a fear of mine.My only advice to you is to familierize yourself with the symptoms of preterm labor. It put my mind at ease to know what to do "just in case"I also realized its better to accept the possibility and overcome it. Stressing/worrying about a situation isnt going to make it go away.Good luck (:And i can safely say, being "obese" i didnt go into preterm labor. My due date is in 8 days (:

I was a big girl with my 1st... 5ft 4in and 215 prepregnancy and 245 when I delivered... at 40 weeks exactly lol. I think that being overweight can lead to additional problems during pregnancy like being at higher risk for preeclamsia and gestational diabetes but if you dont have those issues you should be good.

I have gestational diabetes and I'm overweight too, but my doctor is not concerned about preterm labor, I'm in insulin and thank God everything is going great for now, I even have a cerclage done so they're planning on getting rid of the stitches at 37 weeks
I was overweight with my first and went past my due date. She was a healthy 6lbs 7oz and not even a touch of jaundice. Try not to worry.

I don't believe you have anything to worry about! I'm described as obese and I have 8 days to go! I think it's just precaution because were are at greater risk of GD! Enjoy pregnancy!! It's been a true blessing!

question: I am over weight... Sigh.... But I've had an easy and uncomplicated pregnancy so far. I'm 30 weeks this weekend. I've read all kinds of articles about being over weight and how it can cause preterm labor. I haven't asked my midwife about it yet but plan to at my next appointment. Does anyone have experience with this? I'm not overly worried but it's still a concern. I want my baby to be fully cooked ;)
title: over weight and scared about our preterm labor
